definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: It is reported that the first well was spuded in yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 據報道第一口油井於昨天開鑽。

sentences.english: I hoped that we should spud in tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我們來日誥日能開鑽。

sentences.english: Must prepare at least 200 cubic meter's slurry before spud.
sentences.chinese: 開鑽前應配好至少200方高粘度稠泥漿。

sentences.english: The predicted result is well comparable to the testing result.
sentences.chinese: 預測結果與開鑽後的測試結果吻合較好。

sentences.english: It's time for us to spud in.
Since this well was started to drill, this piece of screen has been used continuously.
sentences.chinese: 自從這口井開鑽以來這塊篩布就一直用着。
